title: Commission Regulation (Euratom) No 1841/2004 of 22 October 2004 repealing Regulation (Euratom) No 2014/76 on the support of projects concerning uranium-prospecting programmes within the territories of the Member States
header:
23.10.2004 EN Official Journal of the European Union L 322/7
COMMISSION REGULATION (EURATOM) No 1841/2004
of 22 October 2004
repealing Regulation (Euratom) No 2014/76 on the support of projects concerning uranium-prospecting programmes within the territories of the Member States
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
recitals:
,
Having regard to the Treaty establishing the European Atomic Energy Community, and in particular Article 70 thereof,
Whereas:
(1) Commission Regulation (Euratom) 2014/76 (1) is no longer applied as uranium-prospecting activities within the territories of the Member States have ceased.
(2) For reasons of clarity and legal certainty, the said Regulation should be expressly repealed,
main_body:
This Regulation shall enter into force on the seventh day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Union.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 22 October 2004.
For the Commission
Loyola DE PALACIO
Vice-President
(1)  OJ L 221, 14.8.1976, p. 17.
